Html:
Hi,

I've got a problem while I'm generating PHPExcel .xls file. I get the error, but it seems to appear when I'm trying to generate excel file too often (one by one in a short period of time) or when I not saving the file to my PC, but I open it from the browser.

I've googled out the similar problem and tried to set the:
$objWriter ->setTempDir('reports');
but to be honest I don't think I've done it corectly...

Can You help me with that please?

//edited out the *domain_name* for safety reasons//

Can anyone help? I'm really strugling but I just can't make it work.
It seems like generating another file is locked for about 1 minute after creating the first one. Could saving the excel file to another location solve the problem?

If you're running PHP with an open_basedir restriction, and the problem is that the PHPExcel script files files (other than PHPEXcel.php itself) are all in subdirectories that open_basedir will not permit you to access. You need to ensure that open_basedir is correctly set to allow PHPExcel access to its own script files.

In PHPExcel 1.7.6 method 'setTempDir' is empty:

/**
* Set temporary storage directory
*
* @deprecated
* @param string $pValue Temporary storage directory
* @throws Exception Exception when directory does not exist
* @return PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5
*/
public function setTempDir($pValue = '') {
      return $this;
 }
From the error messages, these are all thrown by the script trying to access its own script/class files in the autoloader

I'm using hosting, not my own server, so how can I check or set the open_basedir? How can I make it work correctly?

Open_basedir setting in my admin panel:
open_basedir => /home/sichow/:/tmp/:/usr/local/lib/php/:/usr/sbin/:/usr/bin/:/usr/local/bin/:/usr/local/sbin/:/bin/:/sbin/ => /home/sichow/:/tmp/:/usr/local/lib/php/:/usr/sbin/:/usr/bin/:/usr/local/bin/:/usr/local/sbin/:/bin/:/sbin/

Well technically it's a Warning rather than an error message; and the files are still loading correctly, otherwise you'd not be able to generate the file at all... so I'd suggest modifying your PHP error level to ignore these warnings... then they won't be displayed.

Well it's not like that at all - I can generate file, but only sometimes.

When I enter the page and I hit "generate report", I'm beeing redirected to page, that generates the report. At first time everything works fine, but when I'm trying to generate another report within the next few seconds since the last report, I'm getting the errors and the file is not generating. Most of times I have to wait for about one minute between generating reports. What can I do with that?

Thanks for the help, still looking forward to solving the problem.

I have no ideas then, I'm not an expert in running PHP with restrictions such as open_basedir in place... but that's what those warnings suggest to me.

I can see from your initial message that the file is being generated: the

ĐĎŕĄą

in your message is the first few characters of the generated file, but the displayed warning messages are preventing the file from being downloaded.

I will try to losen a bit the error reporting and check if the file is created./downloaded/or what.

I will also try to redirect the output and save it to the file on the server first, and then push the download link to the browser. I think it might be better solution than this used by me right now (sending the phpexcel data to standard output).

In the meantime, maybe someone will join the discussion and help us with his knowlegde.
Have a look at http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/workitem/17840 , that solved a similar problem for me.

IMHO in /Shared/File.php find if (file_exists($pFilename)) { $returnValue = realpath($pFilename);} on line 106-9, these will give rise to a warning if open_basedir restriction in effect, so either comment out these lines or put a try-catch in the function to catch the exception you know will arise and put the rest of the function in the catch.
